title: Authors and Citation
text: Robert Marty. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marty R (2022). googletraffic: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://ramarty.github.io/googletraffic/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {googletraffic: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Robert Marty},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://ramarty.github.io/googletraffic/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Create data Google Maps Traffic data

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: r <- gt_make_raster(location      = c(-1.286389, 36.817222),                     height        = 500,                     width         = 500,                     zoom          = 16,                     webshot_delay = 2,                     google_key    = google_key)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: nbo <- getData('GADM', country='KEN', level=1, path = "~/Desktop") nbo <- nbo[nbo$NAME_1 %in% "Nairobi",]  grid_param_df <- gt_make_point_grid(polygon   = nbo,                                     height    = 500,                                     width     = 500,                                     zoom      = 12,                                     reduce_hw = 100)  r <- gt_make_raster_from_grid(grid_param_df = grid_param_df,                               webshot_delay = 5,                               google_key    = google_key)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: r <- gt_make_raster(location      = c(-1.286389, 36.817222),                     height        = 500,                     width         = 500,                     zoom          = 16,                     webshot_delay = 2)  nbo <- getData('GADM', country='KEN', level=1, path = "~/Desktop") nbo <- nbo[nbo$NAME_1 %in% "Nairobi",]  r <- gt_make_raster_from_polygon(polygon       = nbo,                                  height        = 500,                                  width         = 500,                                  zoom          = 12,                                  webshot_delay = 5,                                  reduce_hw     = 100,                                  google_key    = google_key)

what: Get traffic raster from Bing Maps — bing_traffic
title: Get traffic raster from Bing Maps — bing_traffic
text: function returns raster traffic levels Bing Maps.

title: Get traffic raster from Bing Maps — bing_traffic
code: bing_traffic(latitude, longitude, height, width, zoom, bing_key)

title: Get traffic raster from Bing Maps — bing_traffic
text: latitude Latitude center area longitude Longitude center area height Height width Width zoom Zoom; integer 0 20. information, see bing_key Bing API key

title: Get traffic raster from Bing Maps — bing_traffic
text: Returns georeferenced raster file. file can contain following values: 1 = traffic; 2 = light traffic; 3 = moderate traffic; 4 = heavy traffic.

what: Determine pixel distance in decimal degrees — det_google_pixel_dist_deg
title: Determine pixel distance in decimal degrees — det_google_pixel_dist_deg
text: Based zoom level, determine height/width pixel decimal degrees

title: Determine pixel distance in decimal degrees — det_google_pixel_dist_deg
Determine pixel distance in decimal degrees — det_google_pixel_dist_deg
text: zoom Zoom level

title: Determine pixel distance in decimal degrees — det_google_pixel_dist_deg
text: Returns pixel height/width decimal degrees (integer)

what: Converts Google HTML file to Raster — gt_html_to_raster
title: Converts Google HTML file to Raster — gt_html_to_raster
text: Converts Google HTML file spatially referenced raster file.

title: Converts Google HTML file to Raster — gt_html_to_raster
code: gt_html_to_raster(   filename,   location = NULL,   height = NULL,   width = NULL,   zoom = NULL,   webshot_delay = 10,   save_png = F )

title: Converts Google HTML file to Raster — gt_html_to_raster
text: height Height width Width zoom Zoom level webshot_delay long wait .html file load. Larger .html files require time fully load. save_png function creates .png file intermediate step. Specify whether .png file kept (default: FALSE) polygon SpatialPolygonsDataframe defines region queried.

title: Converts Google HTML file to Raster — gt_html_to_raster
text: Returns georeferenced raster file. file can contain following values: 1 = traffic; 2 = light traffic; 3 = moderate traffic; 4 = heavy traffic.

what: Converts multiple Google HTML files into a raster — gt_htmls_to_raster
title: Converts multiple Google HTML files into a raster — gt_htmls_to_raster
text: Converts multiple Google HTML files single spatially referenced raster file.

title: Converts multiple Google HTML files into a raster — gt_htmls_to_raster
code: gt_htmls_to_raster(   html_files,   webshot_delay,   grid_param_df = NULL,   save_png = F,   print_progress = T )

title: Converts multiple Google HTML files into a raster — gt_htmls_to_raster
text: html_files Vector html_files webshot_delay long wait .html file load. Larger .html files require time fully load. grid_param_df Grid parameter dataframed defined gt_make_point_grid() save_png function creates .png file intermediate step. Specify whether .png file kept (default: FALSE) print_progress Whether print progress show file function processing (default: TRUE)

title: Converts multiple Google HTML files into a raster — gt_htmls_to_raster
text: Returns georeferenced raster file. file can contain following values: 1 = traffic; 2 = light traffic; 3 = moderate traffic; 4 = heavy traffic.

title: Converts png to raster — gt_load_png_as_traffic_raster
text: Converts PNG raster translates color values traffic values

title: Converts png to raster — gt_load_png_as_traffic_raster
code: gt_load_png_as_traffic_raster(   filename,   latitude,   longitude,   height,   width,   zoom )

title: Converts png to raster — gt_load_png_as_traffic_raster
text: img PNG object readPNG

title: Converts png to raster — gt_load_png_as_traffic_raster
text: Returns raster

what: Determine the spatial extent of a Google traffic tile — gt_make_extent
title: Determine the spatial extent of a Google traffic tile — gt_make_extent
text: Based location, height, width, zoom, determines spatial extent Google traffic tile

title: Determine the spatial extent of a Google traffic tile — gt_make_extent
Determine the spatial extent of a Google traffic tile — gt_make_extent
text: latitude Latitude longitude Longitude height Height width Width zoom Zoom level

title: Determine the spatial extent of a Google traffic tile — gt_make_extent
text: Returns extent object

what: Make traffic html from Google — gt_make_html
title: Make traffic html from Google — gt_make_html
text: function returns html traffic Google. gt_html_to_raster() can used convert html georeferenced raster file.

title: Make traffic html from Google — gt_make_html
code: gt_make_html(   location,   height,   width,   zoom,   filename,   google_key,   save_params = F )

title: Make traffic html from Google — gt_make_html
text: location Vector latitude longitude height Height width Width zoom Zoom; integer 0 20. information, see filename Path filename save file google_key Google API key save_params Save .Rds file contains parameters (location, height, width zoom). file can used gt_html_to_raster() function.

title: Make traffic html from Google — gt_make_html
text: Returns html file Google traffic

what: Make multiple traffic html from Google based on grid of points — gt_make_htmls_from_grid
title: Make multiple traffic html from Google based on grid of points — gt_make_htmls_from_grid
text: function returns multiple html traffic Google based grid defined gt_make_point_grid. gt_htmls_to_raster() can used html files georeferenced raster file.

title: Make multiple traffic html from Google based on grid of points — gt_make_htmls_from_grid
code: gt_make_htmls_from_grid(   grid_param_df,   filename_suffix,   out_dir,   google_key,   save_params = F )

title: Make multiple traffic html from Google based on grid of points — gt_make_htmls_from_grid
text: google_key Google API key save_params Save .Rds file contains parameters (location, height, width zoom). file can used gt_html_to_raster() function. location Vector latitude longitude height Height width Width zoom Zoom; integer 0 20. information, see filename Path filename save file

title: Make multiple traffic html from Google based on grid of points — gt_make_htmls_from_grid
text: Returns html file Google traffic

title: Make Google Traffic PNG — gt_make_png
text: Make raster Google traffic data, pixel one four values indicating traffic volume (traffic, light, moderate, heavy).

title: Make Google Traffic PNG — gt_make_png
code: gt_make_png(   location,   height,   width,   zoom,   webshot_delay,   google_key,   out_filename )

title: Make Google Traffic PNG — gt_make_png
text: location Vector latitude longitude height Height width Width zoom Zoom level; integer 0 20. information, see webshot_delay long wait google traffic layer render. Larger height/widths require longer delay times.

title: Make Google Traffic PNG — gt_make_png
text: Returns georeferenced raster file. file can contain following values: 1 = traffic; 2 = light traffic; 3 = moderate traffic; 4 = heavy traffic.

what: Creates grid of points to query Google Traffic — gt_make_point_grid
title: Creates grid of points to query Google Traffic — gt_make_point_grid
text: Querying large location may unfeasible; consequently, may necessary query multiple smaller locations. Based location queried height, width zoom parameters, determines points queried.

title: Creates grid of points to query Google Traffic — gt_make_point_grid
Creates grid of points to query Google Traffic — gt_make_point_grid
text: polygon SpatialPolygonsDataframe defines region queried. height Height width Width zoom Zoom level reduce_hw Number pixels reduce height/width . tiles produced function may exactly overlap. Reducing height width ensures overlap eventually remove blank space.

title: Creates grid of points to query Google Traffic — gt_make_point_grid
text: Returns dataframe locations query parameters.

title: Make Google Traffic Raster — gt_make_raster
text: Make raster Google traffic data, pixel one four values indicating traffic volume (traffic, light, moderate, heavy).

title: Make Google Traffic Raster — gt_make_raster
code: gt_make_raster(location, height, width, zoom, webshot_delay, google_key)

title: Make Google Traffic Raster — gt_make_raster
text: location Vector latitude longitude height Height width Width zoom Zoom level; integer 0 20. information, see webshot_delay long wait google traffic layer render. Larger height/widths require longer delay times.

title: Make Google Traffic Raster — gt_make_raster
text: Returns georeferenced raster file. file can contain following values: 1 = traffic; 2 = light traffic; 3 = moderate traffic; 4 = heavy traffic.

what: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Grid of Coordinates — gt_make_raster_from_grid
title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Grid of Coordinates — gt_make_raster_from_grid
text: Make raster Google traffic data, pixel one four values indicating traffic volume (traffic, light, moderate, heavy).

title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Grid of Coordinates — gt_make_raster_from_grid
code: gt_make_raster_from_grid(   grid_param_df,   webshot_delay,   google_key,   print_progress = T )

title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Grid of Coordinates — gt_make_raster_from_grid
text: grid_param_df Grid parameter dataframe produced gt_make_point_grid webshot_delay long wait google traffic layer render. Larger height/widths require longer delay times. print_progress Show progress tile processed.

title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Grid of Coordinates — gt_make_raster_from_grid
text: Returns georeferenced raster file. file can contain following values: 1 = traffic; 2 = light traffic; 3 = moderate traffic; 4 = heavy traffic.

what: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Polygon — gt_make_raster_from_polygon
title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Polygon — gt_make_raster_from_polygon
text: Make raster Google traffic data, pixel one four values indicating traffic volume (traffic, light, moderate, heavy).

title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Polygon — gt_make_raster_from_polygon
code: gt_make_raster_from_polygon(   polygon,   height,   width,   zoom,   webshot_delay,   google_key,   reduce_hw = 0,   print_progress = T )

title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Polygon — gt_make_raster_from_polygon
text: polygon SpatialPolygonsDataframe WGS84 CRS. height Height width Width zoom Zoom level; integer 0 20. information, see webshot_delay long wait google traffic layer render. Larger height/widths require longer delay times. reduce_hw Number pixels reduce height/width . tiles produced function may exactly overlap. Reducing height width ensures overlap eventually remove blank space. print_progress Show progress tile processed.

title: Make Google Traffic Raster Based on Polygon — gt_make_raster_from_polygon
text: Returns georeferenced raster file. file can contain following values: 1 = traffic; 2 = light traffic; 3 = moderate traffic; 4 = heavy traffic.
